channel.title: Protocol on DistributedFog
channel.description: Recent content in Protocol on DistributedFog

item.title: CoAP
item.description:
CoAP is a specialised web transfer protocol for use with constrained nodes and constrained (e.g., low-power, lossy) networks. RFC 7252 Research HTTP/2, CoAP on device HTTP/2 everywhere else, Security, Californium Cloud Services, MQTT vs CoAP, TinyOS Performance, Transport: Logistics
CoAP is network-oriented protocol with similar features to HTTP but also allows for low overhead, multicast, etc. CoAP operates over UDP (simpler) instead of TCP compensating for unreliability with a retransmission mechanism.

item.title: MQTT
item.description:
MQTT is a publish-subscribe-based lightweight messaging protocol for use on top of TCP/IP. It is designed for connections where a small code footprint is required or the network bandwidth is limited. Wikipedia Research CoAP vs MQTT, MQTT and REST, Push Notifications, Secure MQTT
MQTT-SN is a variation of the main protocol aimed at embedded devices on non-TCP/IP networks, such as ZigBee. As it does not require the TCP/IP stack, it can be used over a serial link where overhead is really small or over UDP.

item.title: RPi
item.description:
The Raspberry Pi is a series of popular small and low-cost single-board computers. It was first developed in the UK by the Raspberry Pi Foundation. Manifold products have been created to accompany, modify, and enhance the Piâ€™s capabilities. Wikipedia Research Health Monitoring, Web of Things Book, Industrial Automation, Environmental Monitoring
Series Comparison RPi CPU RAM WiFi 3 4 x 1.
